column4: I have connected myself to a WIFI connection which gives Internet service through Proxy setting.... So, i can't use my internet through terminal for SUDO APT-GET UPDATE... Please help...
you can tell apt to use a proxy
there's an easier way though. with just an env var, IIRC
that overrides what's in the config file anyway
second way works too, but you have to do it in every login session you want to use apt in
the first way is more permanent
One more question... Should the Username Pwd be given only to http or also to https and ftp
that depends on your proxy server
if you need it to use a browser to go to https, then you need it here too
shut up baby i know it
sudo apt-get update  -> fails for ubuntu 10.10  --  http://pastebin.com/ycRVL3uE
